FuncDef:
The dhcp release-packet source-ip command sets the source IP address in the header of the DHCPv4 RELEASE packet.
By default, the IP address of the interface through which the device is connected to the DHCPv4 server is used as the source IP address in the header of the DHCPv4 RELEASE packet.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the IP address of the interface through which the device is connected to the DHCPv4 server is used as the source IP address in the header of the DHCPv4 RELEASE packet.
-

Indicates that the IP address of a user is used as the source IP address in the header of the DHCPv4 RELEASE packet.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a DHCPv4 user gets offline, the functioning as a DHCPv4 relay, sends a DHCPv4 RELEASE packet to the DHCPv4 server. The dhcp release-packet source-ip command is used to configure the source IP address in the header of the DHCPv4 RELEASE packet.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
